meanings.definition: Proptoses (verb): to cause to protrude or project
meanings.sent1: She proptoses the flowers in the vase to make them stand out.
meanings.sent2: The magician proptoses the rabbit out of the hat for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat proptoses its tail in the air while playing.
meanings.sent4: The sun proptoses its rays over the horizon, signaling a new day.
meanings.sent5: The artist proptoses the colors on the canvas, creating a vibrant painting.

meanings.definition: Proptoses (noun): the condition of having one or both eyeballs abnormally protruded
meanings.sent1: His proptoses was caused by a medical condition affecting his eyes.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with proptoses after noticing the eye bulging.
meanings.sent3: The costume party had a funny theme, and his proptoses added to the humor.
meanings.sent4: In the crowded room, her proptoses made her stand out like a sore thumb.
meanings.sent5: The proptoses in the painting gave the portrait a haunting appearance.
